jobDescription: Under the general direction of the Director of Institutional Research and Reporting,  the Research and Data Analyst is responsible  for providing institutional and external reporting and data analysis that  supports the institutional strategic planning process, enrollment management,  and federal and state compliance as well as support accreditation. The Research and Data Analyst is responsible  for improving data quality and designing or presenting conclusions gained from  analyzing data using statistical tools and programs. This individual will also be  responsible establishing and maintaining archived data and conducting  background research from the public domain and other national research studies  such as compiling comparative information on other colleges and universities.  The job requires the ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks and  deadlines, demonstrate effective written and verbal communication, and find  creative solutions to problems in project design and implementation.Duties & ResponsibilitiesGather and analyze data from various databases and  sources utilizing standard statistical methodsImport, clean, transform, validate, or model data college databases using business intelligence applications such as SQL Server,  Hyperion, or Crystal ReportsEffectively communicate research and data to a  broad audience across the At Columbia, we offer a rewarding  work environment for our faculty and staff. We invite you to join our  talented faculty and staff and become part of our collective aspiration to  ensure Columbia prepares students for success in their creative fields through  innovation, engagement and real-world experiences.Additional InformationTo ensure consideration, please  include a cover letter, salary expectations, and three professional  references in your submission.
